author: shirogat
title: Jakazi Handyman DApp
description: Мы принимаем посредственные услуги и получаем посредственные услуги от непроверенных ненадежных поставщиков услуг и чувствуем себя беспомощными

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has identified an important use case that has global utility, that can be achieved in a decentralized manner using blockchain. Similar use cases can also benefit from the code base that is generated for this project, basically, the project template has a wide allocation in many areas. Therefore this proposal is very much addressing an important challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer claims to have 20 years of experience in training and will be developing the app through developers who will be paid at the rate of $1000 per month, including blockchain development. This looks like an underestimation of the project scope of work However it is also possible. The use case is reasonable and can result in wide usage for Cardano.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal aims to build eight modules and has a defined end state however the KPI is missing and the type of market including possible market size in the first phase if added to the proposal, will add value. The budget for developers is very reasonable or likely to be underestimated. References to developer credentials and the proposer's work reverences will add value to the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think I am competent to assess this proposal as I have been active in project Catalyst since fund 4 and I have experience analyzing business requirements from over 5 years of delivering software solutions for small business and corporations as well.
The problem statement is clear and easy to understand, but it sounds very general. Without being more concrete, my first instinct is to disagree, because I tend to only pay for services from verified providers with good reviews and I very rarely have issues as a result. If this proposal is only about home repairs and maintenance service providers as alluded to in the solution, then that should be stated clearly in the problem statement. If I understand this correctly however, it intends to be a sort of Trustpilot app, but for home repair service providers, which sounds like a good idea. I kind of expect there to already be an application for this purpose however, and I see no mention of market research in the proposal. A quick Google search gave me this result for Canada: https://homestars.com/. I'm sure USA and most developed countries have several similar applications as well.
The detailed plan of the proposal is too sparse in my opinion. It mentions the features this DApp would have, but does not give any reason for why this would have to operate using blockchain technology. In order to learn how this would help our ecosystem grow, I think we would need to hear details about its unique, blockchain enabled features (e.g. certificates / ratings that are hosted on Cardano and cannot be altered etc). 
Due to the lack of details in the plan and the fact that no metrics are mentioned, I have to disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has stated that they have more than 20 years of experience in training and education, plus access to developers familiar with blockchain technology, but no credentials have been provided to back this up. Please note that it has become a standard for proposals to have such information in them (LinkedIn profiles, other social media accounts, websites etc). This is crypto and unfortunately, anyone can just say anything. We need proof to be able to verify the claims that are made.
The budget is not small at $30k (for a Catalyst proposal), but considering how many features the application plans to have, it is extremely unlikely in my opinion that it can be done with just this money. I say that because I work in the software development domain and creating an app of this sort will take 3-6 months at the minimum with a team of about 10 professional developers. Assuming just $2k per person, per month, this would add up to over 60k for only 3 months. I would also suggest that next time you do the budget breakdown in the proposal itself, not in an attached document, as voters reading your proposal might have trouble downloading your files and viewing them. Due to the concerns I mentioned above and the fact that there is no risk analysis here for what is a moderately complex project, I have to strongly disagree that this proposal has a high chance of being implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: As described in the sections above, I got an idea of what the proposal wants to do, but there is no clear detailed explanation of how it will be done and how progress along the way will be measured. KPI's and a step by step roadmap would have probably helped to summarize everything that needs to be done here. As it stands, I strongly disagree that this proposal is clear or auditable enough.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Develop an DApp and onboard reliable, vetted repairs and maintenance professionals for organizations and home owners. This idea is very useful to everyone. But I have yet to see an improvement in the use of blockchain applications compared to the current centralized platform. The features proposed by the proposer here can all be implemented on centralized platforms without any problems.
Besides, I still have not seen a specific plan to implement the Dapp and most importantly, how to attract users to use this Dapp. Because these App linked repair services are very much on the market. So what is more innovative in this Dapp to compete with those products?"
f6_assessments.q1:
"Proposer has more than 20 years in training and education, Access to developers including Plutus pioneer. In which field does Proposer have 20 years of experience? Is it a programming related field? We need more evidence and more specific information about these experiences to confirm the proposer's ability to implement the proposal.
Proposal has just outlined the features that the Dapp will have, but has not given a plan to implement this Dapp. Besides, the important issue of this Dapp is the user. How many people will use it? How many repair service companies will be listed on Dapp? How to reach and find users? Because there are many apps with similar features on the market today. Therefore, finding customers is a big problem"
f6_assessments.q2: Proposal has not yet set out specific goals, key metrics, roadmap, plan and how to use the money of the proposal to accomplish those tasks. Therefore, the proposal is almost impossible to audit

f6_assessments.q0: I really consider this idea, this can make an "Uber for mediocre service" that I believe if it is designed with a gamification model, it will drive a lot of users. Unfortunately, this proposal is just an idea and has no detail. The team just input some key features of their app without any roadmap, key metrics... my advice to them about the key metrics for this idea should be the number of active users including personal and service suppliers, the number of service booking, monthly traffic to the app... these all align with the challenge given.
f6_assessments.q1:
Making a booking app is not simple with just coding the system only, the team must have a good implementation plan that drives both sides of users to their platform and it's the hardest part. It's a mixed plan of a ton of activities. But the team don't show any words about their plan. 
There is no roadmap, no key metrics, no goals, no features explanation, no technical explanation, and no budget breakdown in this project to believe that it will work.
f6_assessments.q2:
Same as the previous comment, we can't audit this proposal because there is nothing. After funding, the team will have to report regularly to Catalyst their progress, hence, the team must provide a roadmap and key metrics for CA/ vCA assesses that is available to audit this project. The more detail in the roadmap the easier on audit and we love it more than a roadmap with just a few headlines without detail. Or the team can explain more about the roadmap in another part of the proposal then just summary it again. Of course, the key metrics must be fitted with the challenge given as first, if not it's failed from impact assessment. 
One more thing is the team must describe how they are aware of the problem context by detailed explaining it, then detailing the solution that must address those problems. If not, it will be hard for everyone to understand what the team wants to do and is it helpful or not. This means the proposal can get a low scoring in all three-part: impact, feasibility, auditability.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is within the challenge, but the proposal doesn't have basic things for assessing the impact: 
- Explanation about how it will add value to Cardano ecosystem, this help convince CA/ vCA and voter to easily clear the impact of the project on the ecosystem
- Key metrics that align with the challenge setting, it will show how the project will affect the ecosystem by specific criteria.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal only have oulined app features, and lacks all basic things for assessing the feasibility. Include: 
- Detailed roadmap to help CA/ vCA know milestones and summary things to do or finish at this time. 
- Detail implementation plan with a detailed explanation about features, actions, activities of their plan. This will help to assess all other parts in the proposal is suitable or not. 
- Detailed budget that should be pointed which/ who it will be used for. Based on the plan, it will be assessed reasonable or not to be funded and help voters make decisions on voting. 
Not just those info only, for more trust the proposal must have: 
- Team info with background or ability, and which roles they are working for in this proposal
- Some relevant risks and how the team will face them. To me, it helps to assess that the team has a well-preparation for their plan. 
And for getting the perfect score of feasibility, the proposal should attach some MVP, samples, evidence, resource... that the team is already done or on going doing it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal doesn't have the basic things for auditing, including: 
- Roadmap with detail and realistic timeline. More detail will help Catalyst team easier on track and check the project regularly, currently, the project team has to report in biweek. 
- Key metrics that are clear and fittable with the plan and vision of the team, of course, must be aligned with the challenge setting. 
And 2 explanation to help Catalyst team easy understand what the proposal want to do: 
- Problem explanation, should be in case studies, context that the team has been aware and motivated to make the proposal.
- Solution explanation, to explain detail about how the solution can help to solve the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The DApp holds potential in and off itself but it makes no mention of how it intends to bring value to the ecosystem itself and be integrated into blockchain tachnologies.
f6_assessments.q1: Without links or access to specific team members and their requisite skills coupled with no breakdown of the requested funds and how they will be allocated makes this proposal impossible to determine feasibility
f6_assessments.q2: No roadmap or KPIs are provided. These need to be in place in order to determine if the DApp is successfully implemented.

solution: Разработать DApp и привлекать надежных, проверенных специалистов по ремонту и обслуживанию для организаций и владельцев домов
experience: Более 20 лет в сфере обучения и образования, доступ к разработчикам, включая пионера Plutus
